reviewText:
With nearly half of the ENTIRE SERIES already available on DVD, you'd think the next logical step would be to release Season 5, right? CBS and Paramount has apparently dropped this idea, and will only be releasing "collections" of the episodes that are considered the "best". There are only 4 episodes on each set, some have been released on DVD already.

I know I should be happy but I'm not. I assume this is for financial reasons (not like CBS and Paramount combined are hurting) and this is better than nothing but it is a lame attempt to appease the fans when nearly half of the series on DVD has been released already. Nearly every tv show known to man is being released on DVD, and they pull a stunt like this? I would say this release should not be supported, but I fear if it's not they will never release seasons of TBAA on DVD again. This is truly a disappointment, and that's an understatement.
A tad disappointed as the inside of the disc box was/is broken leaving the discs to move around freely within the case.

Does anybody know if the DVDs come in separate sleeves or cases when you purchase a single season, like season 8, at a time?

I just added the last two seasons of Touched by an Angel to complete the series, which I intend to view over and again throughout the coming years. The cast has given an excellent performance over the seasons and many of the episodes have touched me deeply. I am only sorry that it ended at season 9. I would welcome it back if they were to start with season ten and continue as long as the writers could come up with meaningful and timely stories.

I ordered and watched all seasons of Touched by an Angel. In our home, we work hard to keep the more pleasant things accented and the cares of the world at a minimum. TBAA  is TV watching that uses the different cares of the world and shows a positive way to get through and out the other side. Not all the good guys win or live and not all the bad guys lose and die. This being the case, the BIGGER picture is the focus and the outcome is positive.

I have purchased all 8 Seasons of Touched By An Angel and I will be buying from Amazon.com (No Merchants!!) Season 9, the
final Season on November 19, 2013. Most of the episodes are ok, and some of them are not so good. As a non-denominational
christian, it saddens me that none of or very few of the episodes dwell on the disbelief of Lord Jesus Christ/or GOD period!!
The ignorance of not knowing your creator is truly sad and unbelievable!!!! Let alone not even having a relationship with our
Creator. Most of all of these episodes dwell on "Angels" but do not dwell on where these celestial beings come from!!! they were
created just as human beings; the universe; and this world we live in was created. I wish that the writers and executive producers
spent more time concentrating on who GOD, OUR FATHER IS; LORD JESUS CHRIST; and LORD HOLY SPIRIT!! instead of dwelling
on "Angels" and leaving "GOD" out of the picture!! The greatest purpose of life is living it to the fullest within GOD's WAY!!!!!  Not
ANGELS!!! (WHOM ARE MERELY MESSSENGERS)!!!! AND WE AS HUMAN BEINGS HAVE SOMETHING EVEN BETTER THAN ANGELS - IT'S CALLED THE BIBLE!!!!  BASIS, INSTRUCTIONS, BEFORE, LEAVING EARTH!!!!  THANK YOU!!  MRS. D.L. WC.
SEPT. 17, 2013

Thank you so much CBS/Paramount and Amazon for this extraordinary gift.  The "Angels" in this, The Eighth Season, will definitely keep me warm through our southern winter.  Some standout episodes here include: Famous Last Words; Angels' Anonymous; A Winter Carol, and The Impossible Dream (featuring a truly soulful performance by Luther Vandross).  This episode is a biographical account of the man whose incredible contribution to the Soul Music Industry will live on forever.  Long live Luther Vandross.

Sugar Coated Saga that seems to Numb, Repeat, & Destroy The Great Touch By The Angel Series Of The Early Day's.
